basics.name: Mikel Xabier Muñoz Basagoiti
basics.label: Industrial Engineer
basics.summary: Double MSc Industrial Engineer, specialized in mechanics and aeronautics, currently working as a Consultant Engineer at ALTEN Belgium. Open-minded, agile, and motivated, I bring a dynamic approach to learning and problem-solving. Committed to technical excellence and innovation, I seek opportunities to contribute to the advancement of industry

work.name: ALTEN Belgium, Brussels, Belgium
work.summary: Working as a Consultant Engineer at under projects in the automotive, aeronautical and energy sectors

work.name: Constellium, Voreppe, France
work.summary: Development of new aluminium alloys by laser powder bed fusion (LPBF) additive manufacturing technology. Mechanical characterisation and metallurgical analysis by different techniques of innovative and efficient systems for high added value applications in the aerospace and automotive sector

work.name: MSMP Laboratory, Aix-en-Provence, France
work.summary: Determination of shear strength of additively manufactured poly lactic acid/flax fibre bio-composite via the iosipescu test

work.name: ZIBIO Group, Bilbao, Spain
work.summary: Impact of the addition of radiopaque loads on the hydrolytic degradation of biodegradable polymers, establishing degradation curves corresponding to different properties for a convenient discussion over the achievement of a highly tenacious and with controlled reabsorption radiopaque implant for biomedical applications

volunteer.summary: Intercultural participation in the construction of dog houses for stray dogs, dissemination activities and promotion in the local society (Kavala, Greece)

awards.title: Nobel Prize in Physics
awards.summary: The Nobel Prizes are five separate prizes that, according to Alfred Nobel's will of 1895, are awarded to 'those who, during the preceding year, have conferred the greatest benefit to humankind.'

publications.name: Zur Elektrody/namik bewegter Körper
publications.summary: It concerned an interpretation of the Michelson–Morley experiment and the properties of light and time. Special relativity incorporates the principle that the speed of light is the same for all inertial observers regardless of the state of motion of the source.

publications.name: Über einen die Erzeugung und Verwandlung des Lichtes betreffenden heuristischen Gesichtspunkt
publications.summary: In the second paper, he applied the quantum theory to light to explain the photoelectric effect. In particular, he used the idea of light quanta (photons) to explain experimental results, but stressed the importance of the experimental results. The importance of his work on the photoelectric effect earned him the Nobel Prize in Physics in 1921.

publications.name: Die Grundlage der allgemeinen Relativitätstheorie
publications.summary: The publication of the theory of general relativity made him internationally famous. He was professor of physics at the universities of Zurich (1909–1911) and Prague (1911–1912), before he returned to ETH Zurich (1912–1914).

projects.name: Quantum Computing
projects.summary: Quantum computing is the use of quantum-mechanical phenomena such as superposition and entanglement to perform computation. Computers that perform quantum computations are known as quantum computers.
